result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Rieckhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must successfully complete Veteran's Court Program. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant to serve 30 days with balance of days to be stayed. 
Huber granted for work, work search, child care and treatment. Defendant may not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances, absolute sobriety is required.
04/29/14 - BTC: Defendant allowed release for 3 hours per day for AA meetings.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.    Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: 15CF1521
Imposed and Stayed.    Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.    Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Helmi Hamad
Status conference on February 24, 2020 at 09:30 am.
Spoke with RR at 10:07 a.m., Badge #9050, warrant canceled.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random UAs and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program. You must report to room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403) by 4:00 pm on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-actor (person, property, residence or family).  No weapons.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant enters G Plea to counts 1 and 2 found G by the court  The criminal complaint is the factual basis the Judge relies on

BTC:  Hold open Ct. 3  -if defendant successfully completes Veterans Court Program, Count 3 will be dismissed.
6 months jail imposed and stayed. cons.  24 months prob. conc  Must successfully complete Veterans Court.  90 days conditional time, serve 30 days and stay 60 days, conc.  Appeal rights given.  court costs and the cost of supervision.  DNA surcharge.  Report in May 3  at 8:30 am  Huber for work, work search, child care and treatment.   CFTS  Huber warnings.  
  Review hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-actor (person, property, residence or family).  No weapons.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jeffrey A Rieckhoff in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.  Jeremy R Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart  An agreement has been reached.  COP to Ct 1 and 2.  On each count the joint recommendation is 6 months jail consecutive and that those sentences be imposed and stayed   2 yrs probation to serve - 90 days jail, if defendant serves 30 days the balance will be stayed.  Ct. 3-held open, if def. successfully completes the Veterans Treatment Program the count will be dismissed.   

BTC: adjourn one week

Bond to be modified to a $750 signature bond, same condition.  Cash bond on deposit is to be forwarded to the defendant to pay a traffic fine
